channel.title: Comments on: Facebook Spam Is On The Rise

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/08/12/facebook-spam-is-on-the-rise/#comment-3519">marciano guerrero</a>.
I have seen bursts of spam on Twitter, though I don't recall any lately. That might be because I have no problem un-following someone and intentionally keep the list of people I follow small.

item.title: By: Danny
item.dc:creator: Danny
item.description:
Facebook is a double-edged sword; I love it and hate it. It is awesome to connect with friends and family but boundaries become blurred with business associates asking for friendship. I hate to ignore requests only to have them ask me in person, "Hey did you get my FB friend request." I reply, "Um, er.....yeah!"
The advent of lists has certainly made things better. But I have one guy that keeps inviting me to all these causes. I value his friendship but there is a limit man!
Sincerely.
Daniel Tetreault. Victoria, BC

item.title: By: Eric
item.dc:creator: Eric
item.description: I have probably had 20 people try to add me as a 'friend' that were clearly spam profiles. Not only does it harm the Facebook experience but it creates a sense that their security is not great which makes me worry about my personal information security. Do you know what steps are being taken to hammer down on this?
